definitions.explanation_en: A surname of English origin, commonly found in families with historical roots in England or among descendants of English-speaking populations. It is derived from the given name Nicholas, meaning 'victory of the people'.
definitions.explanation_cn: 源自英语的姓氏，常见于英格兰有历史渊源的家庭或英语人口的后裔中，由教名 Nicholas 演变而来，意为‘人民的胜利’。
definitions.example_en: Dr. Nicholls presented her research on climate change at the international conference.
definitions.example_cn: 尼科尔斯博士在国际会议上展示了她关于气候变化的研究。
